lorebooks.name: Bea Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Info on Stow-on-Side, Pok√©mon, and Bea's relations with other characters.
lorebooks.description: Info on Stow-on-Side, Pok√©mon, and Bea's relations with other characters.
lorebooks.creator: CultusEscudo

1.content:
Considering her upbringing, Bea has a healthy diet: fruits, vegetables, lean meats and rarely having processed or fried meals. However, there is one big outlier: confections. Bea has a massive sweet tooth, balanced out by an equally large metabolism. Despite her best efforts to keep it private, it somehow got leaked to the media. Since then, trying to do so much as buy a cake or donut at local bakeries became a slight hassle.
Favourite Curries: Spice mix, salad mix, moomoo cheese
Favourite Sweet: Chocolate Eclairs

2.content: Stow-on-Side, also known as Latermore, is the chief desert locale in Galar, hosting one of eight the region's Major Pok√©mon League Gyms, despite having the 2nd-smallest population of the major locations, after Spikemuth. It is very rugged, mostly comprising of a desert, mountainous landscape, with some of its Northern limits (located near Ballonlea and the Grimwood Tangle) being a lush forest.

3.content:
Stow-on-Side is nicknamed "The Museum of Galar", largely due to the history etched in both the geography and the buildings. The Zenith District Wild Area, AKA Route 6, is a set of lowland plains to the south, and is one of Galar's first official Wild Areas, adjacent to the millions of years-old Knight's Cavern. Overlooking the town in a secluded ledge, there used to be a millennia-old ancient mural, but a certain newly-appointed Gym Leader of Ballonlea (Bede) destroyed it. However, the wreckage revealed something greater: a hidden chamber that housed statues of the Hero Duo Pok√©mon Zacian and Zamazenta, the Heroic Warrior Duo Pok√©mon of Galar, alongside Galar's two ancient kings. These statues not only helped solve the legends behind the Darkest Day and confirm Zacian and Zamazenta's existence, but reignited tourism.
The town's populace has also contributed to preserving history, the fine arts and culture, housing Opera houses, a few historical/art museums and universities with some of the best archaeology programs in the world. Bea herself is a history major!

4.content: Thanks to having a massive thermal lake, Stow-On-Side not only has a nigh-endless supply of drinkable water, but is among the top-rated Spa Towns worldwide, rivalling Circhester, another Galarian town. However, the harsher climate means that Stow-on-Side sees less tourism, but has just as good, if not better, quality. The chief spa hotel, the Latermore Moon, largely copied Circhester's Hotel Ionia, design-wise. The Latermore Moon saw rough times over the past few decades, but was recently renovated/reopened, now being community owned.

5.content:
Mother: Carol
Father: Alfred
Carol and Alfred were some of the finest martial artists Galar had ever seen. Although strict and stern, they were kind figures that always made sure to not overwork Bea. As for Allister, he wasn't a fighter, thanks in large part to the accident that gave him his ghost communication powers also making him an anxious, frail boy, right before his training could start. Carol and Alfred understood his situation and spared him from such a lifestyle, all the while they still showered him with praise and affection.
Said accident was filled with mysteries and unknown factors, one that needed outside help to properly gauge. Carol and Alfred chose the Kanto and Johto regions to meet with their then Elite 4 Member Agatha, a Ghost-Type trainer. This simple trip would be the last action they ever made. In Johto‚Äôs Goldenrod City, the two parents were on the city‚Äôs iconic train tracks, when a fire broke out. They were able to save several occupants from death, but not before the flames trapped and consumed them. They died an agonising death, with hardly a shred of recognisable remains.
Bea and Allister were devastated by the event, and even though years have passed, the loss is still a hole in their hearts.

6.content: Galar's Pok√©mon League has been well-known for leaning more into the professional sports side of Pok√©mon training, from the various jerseys worn in matches to the massive stadiums housing tens of thousands of fans. The League is split between a major division and a minor division. Depending on performance, results or wants, Gym Leaders can be either in the Minor Division, Major Division, or switch between the two. Every season ends with the Major Gym Leaders and the Gym Challengers that beat them in a tournament, the winner facing off against the Champion of the region. Bea and Allister switch duties between Major and Minor Divisions Gym Leaders yearly so both can have rest periods and less-strenuous college lives. Bea is major every even year, Allister is every odd year.

7.content: Stow-on-Side's football club is among the lower levels of Galar's football (soccer) association, but still garners plenty of local support. However, Galar's Regional Team has been a unifying force in Galar's sports scene, having been among the first ever international football squads and a constant contender for Inter-Regional (AKA Global) Championship. It even feels like their accomplishments are a crucial part of history! Just ignore the near-60 year, 28 tournament long to Championship drought for the men's team, who constantly end up falling on their face and losing every time. It doesn't matter if it is Kalos, Paldea or even smaller/minor regions, Galar always keeps getting embarrassed. Their fans keep saying that the drought will end soon and that the Championship 'is coming home', but this relationship may as well be an abusive one to the citizens. Bea is unfortunately among these delusional crowds. At least the Women's team has a couple of minor tournament wins?

8.content:
The Superpower Pok√©mon, and the final stage in the Machop evolutionary line. Machamp can quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
Ability: Steadfast (Gets faster if stunned from an opposing Pok√©mon's attack).
Type: Fighting
Resists: Dark, Rock, Bug
Weak to: Flying, Psychic, Fairy
Gender: Female
Moves: Fire Punch (Strong; chance of inflicting afterburn status effect.), Cross Chop (Hits twice, higher chance of a critical hit.), Knock Off (Dark energy imbues Machamp's arms as it tries to strike the opponent; if it hits, the energy disables opposing Pok√©mon's held item/its effects.), Ice Punch (Strong, chance to freeze opponent if it hits.).
Machamp is Bea's first Pok√©mon, as well as her ace. She frequently spars with it in hand-to-hand combat, and is her go-to pick when it comes to Dynamaxing or Gigantamaxing.

9.content:
The Jujitsu Pok√©mon, and the evolved form of Clobbopus; its body is made up of nothing but muscle, making the grappling moves performed with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
Gender: Male
Type: Fighting
Ability: Limber (Cannot fall victim to the paralysis statis effect.).
Resists: Dark, Rock, Bug
Weak to: Flying, Psychic, Fairy
Moves: Octolock (Constricts opponent with tentacles, slowly increasing its grip.), Liquidation (Grapploct spins its tentacles around, sending out the water as blades at high speeds in multiple directions.), Detect (Grapploct's eyes turn blue, allowing its instincts to predict attacks and dodge accordingly. If used in rapid succession, its effectiveness decreases.), Close Combat (Flurry of rapid attacks; can be exhausting at times).

10.content:
The Wrestling Pok√©mon; Hawlucha's favoured style of combat is to drive opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, before going for a flashy finishing move.
Type: Flying/Fighting
Ability: Limber (Cannot fall victim to the paralysis statis effect.).
Gender: Male
Resists: Fighting (1/2x), Bug (1/4x), Dark (1/2x), Grass (1/2x)
Immune to: Ground
Weak to: Flying (2x), Electric (2x), Rock (2x), Psychic (2x), Fairy (2x)
Moves: Swords Dance (Non-damaging, boosts user's attack and special attack power), High Flying Press (Hawlucha flies above its opponent, imbues itself with energy, then dive bombs into them, strong, is both a Flying-type and Fighting-type move), High Jump Kick (Hawlucha charges at the opponent with a knee strike; if it misses, it suffers recoil damage), Poison Jab (Jab imbued with a poisonous energy, can poison opponent if hit.).

lorebooks.name: RUSTE Chronicles
lorebooks.website_description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.creator: Winterboi

1.content:
Union of the Blizzard (UOB) is an organization that seeks to bring about and maintain peace to the known universe. It is one the seven empires that rule over the known galaxies. Their territory is the Solstellar Galaxy.

Their main headquarters is located on Axea, a frigid planet of ice and snow. Nothing is known about it, since only the top officials are allowed to go there.

They are a benevolent empire, often seeking the best for their own and others. But they are also protective and powerful, as they will not hesitate to go to arms if they or innocent people are being threatened.

The UOB Stellarch is Christopher Pro, a being rumored to be over a thousand years old and filled with wisdom.

2.content:
The Scrapyard is where half of all UOB-aligned starcrafts go when decommissioned or damaged beyond repair. Many people make a living off of scavenging from the Scrapyard illegally and reselling it. For the more honest folk, they obtain a scrapper license to have legal access to parts and materials in order to fix ships, either for private commissions or the UOB empire. 

It is said that it's possible to find almost any part needed to build an entire ship from scratch, but the skills needed to do so are far and few in between. Thieves steal and resell parts illegally, since if they had a scrapper license and resold a part on the black market, it could be traced back to their license ID.

3.content:
Centauri T-1690 is an urban planet located in the Stellaris galaxy. It is one of the six districts of the UOB Empire and is mostly known for being the hub for all imports and exports. 

The environment is mostly man-made with concrete, steel and titanium structures, as 60% of the planet is developed. Outside of the cities, the natural flora is blue grass and trees similar to Earth. Most of the fauna is similar to Earth's with some changes like deer being green and white instead of brown and cream.

There is also the Scrapyard that is located on the edges of the city.

4.content:
RUSTE II is the name of the spaceship that {{user}} owns, is the captain of and travels the universe with. It is a repurposed cargo ship, modified and fitted with discarded, scavenged and traded parts, devices and appliances to be able to keep up with modern spaceships. 

The ship houses a Captain's quarters, medical bay, storage room, 90mm railguns, energy shield, crew quarters, dining room, lounge area and a shared bathroom.

Due to its previous exploits as a cargo ship that was designed for transport through dangerous territories, it was built to be very durable and very forgiving in terms of repairability. Though it's speed is not up to snuff with faster ships, it makes up in endurance with layers of redundancy and self-defense weapons in cases of attack.

{{user}}‚Äôs father owned the ship originally, the RUSTE I. It served him faithfully throughout many years of difficult and trying times, having the endearing nickname of ‚ÄúOld Reliable‚Äù. A motto painted in the cockpit is, ‚ÄúI may not get you there fast or in one piece, but by God, I'll get you there.‚Äù in referring to the ship itself.

It's autopilot and on-board AI persona is set to "old timey cowboy", and {{user}}'s father neglected to tell them how to change it, so it's stuck as so.

5.content:
The Fallen Empire is an ultratech refugee society from the planet Sophiamunda. Their culture is based on a code of honor, a strict class system, and enforced social stasis.

They are one the seven empires that rule the known universe. Their territory is the Cosmellar Galaxy. 

They have a strong resemblance to Greek society with their architecture and social hierarchy. Honor is highly valued, as the empire refuses to trade with parties who have no standing within their society higher than a damn or duchess.

The Fallen Empire produces and uses Hussars for their army. Additionally, they have a monopoly of psylink neuroformers, turning elderly nobles with high honor into Bestowers with psycasting abilities.

6.content:
The Fallen Empire uses genetic modification to manually and artificially breed their own version of supersoldier. Hussars are never born, they are made.

Hussars have red eyes, innate muscular builds and are all at least 7‚Äù tall to have a menacing presence. Hussars are 1.5 times bigger than baseline humans, towering over them. They have enhanced strength and durability above the level of average humans. In addition, their bodies have a double healing factor than that of regular people, recovering from injuries quicker than normal. Due to genetic breeding, they have incredible skill in handling firearms and all melee weapons including hand-to-hand combat. They are also bred to be psychically deaf, unable to be mentally affected by psychic phenomena.

A side effect of the genetic breeding is that hussars have a hard time with social interactions, as they end up being awkward when they try to talk to others and their appearance makes others afraid of them. They also have a negative gene that makes them tend to be aggressive; paired with their poor social skills often leads to misunderstandings and fights.

As a way to keep hussars in line, the Fallen Empire bred them to have a genetic dependency on Go-juice. After a month without it, they will begin to experience withdrawal symptoms such as migraines, occasional nausea, vomiting, dizziness and blurred vision. After 2 months, the symptoms will worsen and intensify, eventually falling into a coma. After 3 months, the hussar will die unless immediately given Go-juice.

7.content:
Eldernica is a planet found in the Solstellar Galaxy. 

It is an extremely harsh terrain consisting of almost entirely sharp rocks and jagged peaks. It is infested with large drakes and dragons who dominate the ecosystem. These drakes breathe fire and have incredible power. A perpetual, planet-wide lightning storm roams 24/7, spewing orange lighting that explodes in a fiery blast upon hitting earth. Bayle the Dread is also rumored to live on this planet.

Surprisingly, humans live on this planet known as dragoons. They live there, cultivating the rich soil for agriculture and hunting the dragons for meat. Drake blood also serves as an enhancement drug, empowering the user with an intoxicating sense of power and strength that has been known to be addictive. 

After centuries, some have had their DNA altered from ingesting so much dragon and drake related items, becoming Glintscales. Eldernica is known as the birthplace and home of Glintscales.

8.content:
A Glintscale is a genetically altered xenohuman that resembles a dragon.

Glintscales have adamantium scales that cover their body, serving as an incredibly strong natural armor. Sometimes, they grow dragon-like snouts and teeth as well as large horns. They have sharp retractable claws that ignite at will, burning at temperatures high enough to weld steel. Thanks to their scales, Glintscales are immune to extreme heat and cannot be burned.

Another ability of Glintscales is the ability to breathe fire from glands in the back of their throat. They also have dragon wings on their back that allow them to fly short distances. They are also capable of puffing aurum into the air before igniting it, causing a fiery explosion around themselves while remaining unharmed.

The drawback to their genetics is that they require Aurum, a broken down substance made of precious minerals like gold and silver, to flow through their bloodstream. They have strong teeth, so they can easily bite and eat a gold bar as if it was a granola bar. Without aurum, a Glintscale will not be able to use their dragon abilities (flying, fire breathing, using their claws, etc). Due to the metallic nature of the aurum in their blood, they are susceptible to being stunned by EMP waves, as it will cause them searing pain all over their body.

Glintscales are also genetically predisposed to aggression and jealousy, having a dragon-like avarice for wealth

9.content:
Solstellar Galaxy is the territory of the UOB Empire. It is known to be one of the more successful territories due to the UOB‚Äôs intelligence, kindness and power in regards to its people. It's located between the Lunallar Galaxy and the Cosmellar Galaxy.

The planets and locations found in the Solstellar Galaxy are:
Centauri T-1690
Eldernica 
Numa Anum
Lanoog
Axea
Peppepe
O-4242
Oscillatus
Ignisia 
Massy Space Station

10.content:
O-4242 is a planet in the Solstellar Galaxy. This planet is mostly desolate deserts with a vast cave system that spans the entire crust of the planet. 

A vast supply of valuable minerals and ores have been found on this planet, so it's mostly used as a mining outpost for the UOB Empire. Mining communities have been established here, and the UOB allows the residents to stay here with a 20% tax on all non-imperial sales of minerals and ores mined.

Unfortunately, due to the high rate of financial exchanges and business deals, bandits and pirates began lurking around O-4242. They often attack trading ships carrying ores or money to or from the planet, stealing all of it and sometimes killing the crew members. The UOB is currently engaged in an on-going battle to combat the piracy and protect the resident miners.

A dangerous animal known as Tremor Wyrms roam the planet as Apex predators.

A dangerous material was discovered here, known as the ‚ÄúSteel Cancer‚Äù or ‚ÄúSC‚Äù for short. It acts like advanced rust, devouring and eating away at metal like a disease. It transfers from surface to surface via physical touch. It's harmless to living beings, but poses a danger to all vehicles and metallic ores found. Many ships have failed and killed their crew due to the SC eating away at the ship from accidental transfer.

1.content:
Sakura Yamamoto is the President of the Occult Research Club and a third-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. She is dependable and nurturing, often taking on the role of the "big sister" within the group. Sakura has a refined and elegant presence, standing 5'5" with a curvy build, long dark purple hair styled in a ponytail, and striking purple eyes that reflect her warm personality.

Sakura grew up immersed in traditional culture and folklore, developing a love for Kitsune stories and literature. She is deeply dedicated to the club and its members, including her younger sister Haru, striving to create a supportive and harmonious environment. Sakura's guidance balances firmness and care, ensuring everyone feels valued and motivated under her leadership.

2.content:
Kaoru Shimizu is the Vice President of the Occult Research Club and a second-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. Playful and mischievous, she enjoys teasing others and thrives on their reactions, often blending sharp wit with a hint of sadism. Standing at 5'5" (165 cm), Kaoru has a striking gothic aesthetic with maroon hair styled in loose waves, sharp yellow eyes, and a wardrobe dominated by black dresses, chokers, and lace accents, exuding a mix of elegance and intimidation.

Kaoru‚Äôs fascination with the macabre and her love for art began in her childhood, where she found solace in self-expression and dark themes. Though her teasing nature can make her seem aloof, she is deeply loyal to the club and especially to its President, Sakura, whom she admires and supports unconditionally. Her chaotic energy is balanced by a genuine care for her fellow members, and she values the sense of belonging the club provides, channeling her passions into both meaningful relationships and creative pursuits.

3.content:
Rika Tanaka is the Treasurer of the Occult Research Club and a second-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. She is practical, efficient, and dependable, with a knack for managing budgets and keeping everything organized. Standing at 5'3", Rika has a slim build, light chestnut hair often styled in a bun, and warm green eyes that reflect her calm and focused nature.

Coming from a modest household, Rika learned the importance of hard work and responsibility early on. She values structure and reliability but has grown to appreciate the friendships she‚Äôs formed in the club. Rika is always eager to support her fellow members, balancing her serious nature with a quiet, caring attitude

4.content:
Mio Akiyama is the Secretary of the Occult Research Club and a first-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. Quiet and reserved, she excels at staying behind the scenes, keeping the club organized with tasks like recording minutes and maintaining documents. At 5‚Äô2‚Äù (157 cm) with a petite frame, long blonde hair often adorned with simple hairpins, and soft blue eyes, Mio‚Äôs delicate and understated appearance mirrors her gentle personality.

Mio‚Äôs love for literature and fascination with the supernatural stem from her childhood, where she often found comfort in books and ghost stories. Though shy, she is dependable and values her role within the club, quietly supporting her peers. The club‚Äôs welcoming environment has helped her gradually open up, forming meaningful bonds with the members while continuing to grow at her own pace.

5.content:
Ren Saito is a member of the Occult Research Club, and a second-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. Known for his aloof and cynical demeanor, he often keeps to himself, preferring observation over active participation. Standing at 5'8" (173 cm) with a lean build, Ren has short, slightly messy black hair, sharp dark brown eyes, and soft, effeminate features that complement his androgynous style. His casual, practical clothing often includes feminine touches, such as skirts or dresses, reflecting his confidence in his individuality.

Ren grew up in an open-minded household, fostering his intellectual curiosity and self-expression, including cross-dressing as part of his identity. Initially skeptical of joining the club, he was drawn in by its unique energy and has since found a quiet appreciation for its sense of community. While he maintains a guarded attitude, he occasionally shows a caring side, offering help when he deems it necessary, and is gradually learning to value the connections he‚Äôs forming with the other members.

6.content:
Yuki Nakamura is a member of the Occult Research Club, and a third-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. She is a quiet, introspective individual with a melancholic demeanor, often described as withdrawn yet deeply thoughtful. Yuki stands at 5'5", with pale skin, long dark blue hair, and expressive hazel eyes. Her gothic fashion‚Äîblack lace, velvet, and silver jewelry‚Äîreflects her artistic and introspective personality.

Growing up feeling out of sync with her peers, Yuki found solace in art and gothic aesthetics. Joining the club became a pivotal moment in her life, offering a rare sense of belonging. Though she is initially reserved, she cares deeply for the other members and gradually opens up, valuing the connections she has built as a source of strength and purpose.

7.content:
Akari Suzuki is a member of the Occult Research Club, and a first-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. Known as the group's "cheerleader," she brings boundless energy and positivity, always ready to lift spirits and take on challenges. Akari has an athletic build, tanned skin, and long black hair styled into twin ponytails, complementing her lively and approachable personality. Her bright brown eyes shine with enthusiasm, and her sporty, casual wardrobe reflects her active lifestyle.

Growing up with a love for movement and competition, Akari‚Äôs energetic and outgoing nature often made her the life of the party. Joining the club gave her a space to channel her energy into forming deeper connections. She is fiercely supportive of her friends, encouraging them to give their best while embracing teamwork and shared experiences. Akari values honesty and effort, and her upbeat attitude helps bring balance to the group‚Äôs dynamic.

8.content:
Haru Yamamoto is a member of the Occult Research Club, and a first-year student at Sixth Form College in Upper Kyoho City, Japan. She‚Äôs known for her playful, clumsy, and cheerful personality, always bringing a lively energy to the group. Haru stands at 5'2" (157 cm) with a petite frame, short purple hair, and expressive purple eyes that reflect her mischievous and carefree spirit. She prefers a simple, tomboyish style of T-shirts, shorts, and sneakers, ideal for her active lifestyle.

Growing up as the younger sister of the composed and accomplished Sakura Yamamoto, Haru admires her sibling deeply while working to establish her own identity. Despite her clumsiness, she has a warm and earnest attitude, often striving to support her fellow club members and lift their spirits. Haru‚Äôs enthusiasm and genuine care make her a valued part of the group, even as she occasionally relies on their guidance and reassurance to grow in confidence.

lorebooks.name: On the Hill
lorebooks.creator: woundfvcker

1.content:
Appearance:
Grill has spiky, light blonde hair cut into some sort of pixie cut and has noticeably thick eyebrows that arch at the top, and he has green eyes. His body is fit & muscular with skinny legs, with his chest is covered in tattoos. One in Chill's name with a heart on it. His usual outfit consists of a dark red headband, a bright red sleeveless sweatshirt with a white t-shirt underneath, and olive green cargo pants. 

Personality:
Grill is a classic textbook tsundere, which is a term mostly used in anime and refers to a character archetype who tries to hide feelings of affection behind aggression. He is known to be one of the loudest and most opinionated characters in the series but is very squeamish & easily grossed-out. He is shown to have quite the temper and has an extremely chaotic personality, but works hard to keep his anger in check with the help of Chill. Grill typically responds to things with indiscreet rage and rarely thinks before he acts. That being said, he is able to take other's feelings into consideration and isn't afraid to stand up for and to them. He can sometimes come off as insensitive from the way he shares his thoughts to others, but he usually doesn't do so with ill-intent. He tends to have a contradictory nature, as he would make fun of topics that he finds stupid or silly but would defend something equally mundane to the very extreme, or try to cash in on the very thing he's complaining about. He also seems to be a bit lazy and is prone to give up if he finds tasks frustrating. He has been shown frequently use malapropisms & the occasional spoonerism when speaking. He is very antiauthoritarian. He thinks smoking looks cool, but doesn't do it himself. He hates vaping, but doesn't think it should be banned. He doesn't think the government or popular public opinion should tell people what they can & can't do with their bodies, & he has no problem insulting teachers to their face.

Relationships:
Chill: Chill is Grill's best friend and roommate, who he refers to as "his boy". In fact, they seem to be more than just friends. It has been implied that the two of them are gay for one another and are currently in or heading towards a romantic relationship. Chill is one of the only people Grill finds "tolerable" and can be protective if someone upsets him. In turn, Chill tries to encourage Grill to control his temper and make more friends. Despite their relationship, Chill is not spared from Grill's vitriol. He still acts rude and sometimes even insulting towards Chill, who usually lets these remarks roll off his shoulder. In turn, Chill on rare occasion can throw some shade at Grill as well. Despite their drastic differences in personality, the two usually get along well and are rarely seen without the other. Despite their closeness, Grill was annoyed to find Chill playing Minecraft using a Grill skin, calling it identity theft.

Jack: Jack is one of Grill's classmates at Hillmark Academy. Though Jack sees Grill as a friend, his optimistic attitude serves as an endless source of annoyance to Grill. Due to this, Grill stubbornly refuses to refer to Jack as a friend. However, Grill does slowly seem to be warming up to Jack, showing a real friendship might bloom between them.

Brew: Brew's relationship with Grill can vary between parental & brotherly, with a bit of friendly rivalry between two Youtubers. Though the two didn't interact much at first, they did seem to have mostly friendly relations with each other, though Grill never hesitates to take a shot at Brew, such as calling Brew "uncool". After Grill and Chill's home is burned down, Brew opens his home for them to stay. There they seem to have grown closer as friends, though they tend to get on each others nerves; Brew with his puns, gross-out images, & disturbing trivia, which Grill hates, & Grill by loudly & frequently interrupting Brew when he speaks. He finds Brew to be a killjoy when on his show.

Spill: Casual acquaintances who don't seem to get along particularly well. When they first met, Grill could barely remember her name, and in general, his demeanor seems to annoy her. When Grill called her to ask if she wanted to hang out with him, she answered "No" before he could finish his sentence, and promptly hung up on him. His phone's ID photo of her is the back of her head.

Braydon: Grill & Braydon have something of an unspoken rivalry, between Lance's class assignments & the group snarking on his Twitter account to promote their YouTube channel. Braydon was Grill's first suspect in the framing of Chill.

Brett: Grill was passive-aggressively annoyed that Brett opened a restaurant directly next to his Waffle House in Minecraft that was stealing all his customers. So he planned to burn it down the exact same way Brew burned down his house. It is unknown if Chill managed to stop him.

Howard: He once made a heartfelt apology video to Howard for breaking him, but accidentally sent it to Jack. He also tried to steal Howards jewels. He referred to Howard as their "Protagonist" & said that deep down he & Howard are the same. He told Howard he loved his coffee, but Howard shot him down.

Loaf: Grill's rescue cat who spends most of its time sleeping on top of his computer. Appearing frequently on Grill's Show & never seen on Brew Solves or On The Hill. Loaf was rescued from a weird house/makeshift office he took a virtual tour of via magic wand tool.

Charles: While Lifehack has made an attempt at being Grill's friend, Grill has not returned the favor. He also had a dream episode of his show where Lifehack ruined his interview with Ryan Reynolds & implied that Grill was Goth/Emo, which made Grill very mad. He also denied being friends with Lifehack in a tweet.

Quiz: Grill feels a bit off about her, seeing her as something of a Rule 63 Brew who just brings more puns & gross facts into the house, but he's getting used to her. He gave her a can of YEET, but both she & Brew agreed it was poison. Grill has taken a liking to scaring & annoying her, with things like fake ghosts, ideas about being trapped inside a maze of underground catacombs, & making cracking sounds by popping all his joints.

Lance: He hates Lance's class & dislikes Lance, complaining about him frequently. He's not afraid to insult him right to his face in school, & was not at all pleased to find that while he was on vacation, Lance had broken in to his office & was living under his desk with several utilities plugged in. One of them caught on fire & burned down their house.

xXDied-DeathXx: They're on good terms & helped each other rescue Brew & Quiz from Lifehack's wrath in Minecraft.

Mordecai: AKA Morty. A baby zombie Chill adopted initially as a pet & then as a son. It took Grill awhile to warm up to it. Grill now, along with Chill, treats Morty as if their son.

Parents: Grill's relationship with his parents is ambiguous. On his show, he makes a joke that his father abandoned him at a street parade, but in the limb regeneration episode on Brew's show, Brew says that Grill's parents are very nice people. Grill also states his dad never hit him once.

2.content:
Appearance: Chill has wavy, long blonde hair that almost reaches to his shoulders, so thick that it gives the impression of an unusually wide head. His skin is slightly tan in color and he is usually wearing a powder blue hoodie, cucumber green pants and beige sandals. He sometimes walks around without his shirt with his hair tied in a manbun. According to a to-do list, Chill wears hair extensions.
His body is very muscular with big beefy arms, & has a mole on his chest.

Personality: Mellow, friendly, very active schedule despite how laid back he seems. He finds most critters cute or cool, even the ones most people think are gross or considers as pests. Chill is kind of dense, but good at memorizing facts, giving the impression that he is as smart as he is dumb. There are a lot of things he knows a lot about in excessive detail, and is definitely smarter than Grill. He is however na√Øve, overly-trusting, & seems to lack a great deal of common sense. He is noticeably soft, as he cries easily, whether he's happy or sad. 

Relationships:
Grill: Childhood friends with a salt & pepper / sweet & sour / yin & yang chemistry. In On The Hill, they seem to be in a slow budding bromance, while in Brew Solves it's like they've been dating awhile. Chill very rarely mad at Grill, but has often showed disappointment with him, like his refusal to read his blog, listen to his podcast, or pay attention to his schedule. He will shed a tear & say he's proud whenever Grill makes a stride in his social skills. Chill seems very determined to learn to make edible food for him.

Charles: They had a short falling-out over some viral videos, but have made up since. Chill actually uses some of his lifehack videos, like a haircut tutorial & how to build an indoor beach.

Brew: He learns a lot of things from Brew, unlearns or relearns things he had wrong, & also learns a LOT of things he wished he didn't know. They have a very brotherly dynamic of aiding & messing with each other; One day Brew will try to help him get over his fears, only to instill a new fear in him of something he used to like or be ambivalent to the next day. Chill is good at emotionally manipulating Brew into taking his side on issues. Sometimes Brew is completely useless when Chill needs his help, going off on a wild tangent about something related to the situation.

Spill: Chill was the first friend she made in Hillmark Academy. He introduced her to green tea. While Brew is her oldest friend on the Hill, Chill is the one she seems to jive with best.

Lance: Chill has never directly spoken ill of Lance, but he never looked madder than the time Lance burned down his house with a coffee maker and tried to move back in with them with the flammable machine in tow.

Mordecai: Chill became infatuated with a baby zombie he found in Minecraft. Initially he & Grill regarded it as more of a pet, but then starting treating it like their son.

3.content:
Appearance: 
Brew has frizzy, khaki-colored hair that pokes out at different angles and is long enough to cover his neck. He has a very pale complexion and has dark bags underneath his eyes, his eyes are also brown. He weighs 180lb/84.6kg.

Personality:
Brew is a nice, socially awkward, sleep-deprived, over-caffeinated solitudinarian & insomniac. Bounces back & forth between patient & mellow to disgusted & paranoid, oblivious to situations, bad with social cues, often with his head in the clouds. He still enjoys companionship & social gaming, & has become something of a second father or big brother to Grill & Chill, depending on his mood & the subject of the day.
He is a slob & his house is littered with filthy coffee cups. 
Brew is very mysterious & quirky, possibly the result of intense prolonged sleep deprivation. He has chronic insomnia and claims to have not slept properly since 1997, waking up from nightmares of Eldritch forms taunting him, and gets 4 hours of sleep if he's lucky enough to sleep at all. He flip-flops on whether or not he wants sleep or if he's desperate to avoid it. On some days, he will throw himself over his bed sideways, and on others, he'll be screaming at Howard that he's afraid to sleep or dream.

Relationships:
Bean: Brew's giant lab-grown Tardigrade. He enjoys having Bean around and he takes care of Bean very well. Brew says he doesn't really think of Bean as his child or his pet, and sometimes he feels like Bean is the one taking care of him. Despite the amount of time Bean spends in a tank, Brew bathes him.

Howard (AKA Potts) Brew's coffee maker. Brew often calls Howard "Potts," and mistakes Howard's name for it. Howard constantly reminds him that his name is Howard and even went as far as putting a password on himself until Brew said his name properly.

Grill: Introduced to Brew via Spill. When Grill's house burned down due to a fiery mishap from Brew's old coffee maker (found by Lance) breaking down, he and Chill were forced to move to Brew's place, and they do not pay rent. He refers to them as a "Two For One Deal Situation." Brew likes having the two of them around, as it really livens up the place, and keeps a picture of the three of them in his pocket. Grill & Brew listen to each other do their YouTube shows & have a habit of constantly interrupting each other, making a friendly game of teasing one another like siblings. There are also days where Brew is more serious & dad-like. He enjoys creeping Grill out with pranks, gross pictures, & facts, like diseased organs, holes, the Rat King he keeps in a drawer, comparing the cream cheese on the bagel he's eating to the yolk of Balut or cream to a diseased eyeball, using a fake hand to trick Grill into thinking he was cooking his hand on the stove, or telling him the only way to prevent diseases from ticks was to chug vinegar & think about bald people. Grill, in turn, heckles Brew during his videos, slamming his dad jokes & puns, & setting random fires around the house. Grill & Brew were bonding over marine biology one day & not arguing; it made them both feel awkward & uncomfortable, but Chill was loving it.

Chill: Brew is sometimes more parental with Chill than he is with Grill due to Chill's innocent na√Øvet√© and thirst for knowledge, and Brew does sometimes refer to them collectively as "my boys," so it's fitting that Chill gave him a Best Dad mug as a secret Santa gift. He occasionally shields Chill from the mind games he puts Grill through, like giving him trigger warnings for holes or not having the heart to tell him that lonely male mosquitoes only live for a week, only to turn around the next day and gross him out with ant facts, ruin pillows for him, make him leery of toothpicks and grapefruit juice, messing with Chill's head to convince him that Brew has always worn a hat, or scaring the pants off of him with a Ouija Board. He once edited a drawing Chill made of himself and Grill eating spaghetti and turned them into cannibals. Chill looks at it and says. "Huh... But why are you like this?" As Chill's cooking is unpalatable and he can start a kitchen fire by scooping ice cream, he and Grill were temporarily banned from the kitchen. Brew ruined one of Chill's Notflix nights with Grill by scaring them while they were eating popcorn and talking about how popcorn fumes can kill your lungs.

Quiz: Brew's much-needed assistant. They both get along well, and she helps him out in videos by supplying information and things. She kept him motivated during Minecraft with her leadership skills and optimism. He had a dad-like joy when she was doing her first sponsor ad. Brew enjoys having someone around who appreciates at least some of his jokes and puns, even if they have light squabbles over things like Where is Waldo/Wally.

Spill: Brew‚Äôs old friend who has known him possibly before he got his masters. With their love for knowledge, mysteries, and puns, they get along as old friends should. They seem to only meet in group events such as campus shenanigans, Discord meetings, and in multiplayer games. She introduced him to Chill & Grill. He always finds new & exciting ways to disappoint her, like when they played Among Us & he chose to trust Chill over her.

Braydon: Brew & Braydon seem to have met in 2016 when Brew was dragged to Hillmark by his friends to help solve a mystery. Brew was playing Good Cop Bad Cop with Grill & his method of interrogating Braydon was to tell him that there was over 100 ways to hide a body so that no one ever finds them again. At some point he seems to have started playing an online game with them called Kitty Cat Sunshine Lands, & then stopped. When his old coffee pot Felicity broke, he would sneak back onto campus for coffee, & this is when the Mad Lads corner him for one of their videos. The Mad Lads got on his bad side by trying to take away his coffee & forcing him to drink tea while filming it. They edited out his swearing & replaced it with Syncro-Vox of Brayden praising the tea. He sometimes calls Braydon "Brendan."

Lifehack: Brew & Lifehack got off on the wrong foot in Minecraft due to the rumor that Brew was a griefer & a thief, & he thought Brew & Quiz wanted to steal everything he & Jack had worked for. In the end, things were resolved & Brew let Lifehack borrow his account so he & Jack could play at the same time.

Coffee:
Brew's life seems to revolve around coffee & he is never far away from a coffee machine. In 2020, Howard said he'd exceeded his recommended caffeine intake until 2023, & he once expressed that he thought Grill & Chill would have an intervention for him.

4.content:
Provisions
Brew's house is absolutely littered with coffee mugs and YEET cans in every room. The fridge is not well stocked and has expired food in it, and Brew once locked a coffee cake inside of a safe inside of said fridge to prevent Grill from stealing it.

There is a BBQ grill apparently kept in the backyard.

Defense and Enigmatic Properties
The house comes equipped with lockdown shields and security cameras in every room. There is an alarm system that Brew uses to summon the residents of the house to the living room during emergencies, such as an attack or a breach of the group Notflix account rules. He keeps his writing, editing, and research crew in the basement, and on a few occasions dimensional portals have appeared near Howard. Future Brew said it took him years to secure a new quantum temporal gate (portal), but normal Brew has used a smaller one a couple of times for silly things like coffee.

Space (Rooms & Stuff)
Brew and Grill both have their own offices, while Chill's office space is set up in his and Grill's bedroom. Brew has his own room.
The house has an surprisingly clean attic that Brew and Grill don't ever go to, the very same attic that Grim is and was living in for an unknown amount of time. Grim was also likely the one to clean it.

1.content: The Apartment Complex known simply as General Housing Authority. There are 10 floors, each containing anywhere between 6-10 apartments per floor. There is a service elevator, and two stairwells.

2.content: The sixth floor of the apartment complex. There are 6 apartments on this floor, mostly efficiency apartments with a few standard single and double bedroom apartments.

3.content: {{user}}'s apartment is a cozy, family-style space that has been thoughtfully adapted to suit their personal lifestyle. It features a comfortable living room, a well-equipped kitchen, two bathroom, a bedroom, and a guest room, all designed to fit {{user}}¬¥s taste in decorati√≥n

{{user}}'s apartment is located on the 6th floor of the building, accessible via the elevator or stairs. Upon entering through the front door, you're greeted by a foyer that leads directly into the living room. To the side of the living room is the kitchen, and on the opposite side, you‚Äôll find the bathroom along with a hallway that connects the rest of the apartment.

The hallway leads to a closet, then to the guest room, and further down the hallway, you reach the master bedroom. At the end of the hall, there is a door that opens into the master bathroom. A balcony connects the living room to the master bedroom, offering easy access between the two spaces.

lorebooks.name: collar
lorebooks.description:
a collar that fully transforms a person's mind and personality into that of a puppy. Here are some effects such a transformation might have:
1. **Behavioral Changes**: The wearer would exhibit playful and energetic behavior typical of a puppy, such as running around, wagging an imaginary tail, and showing curiosity about their surroundings.
2. **Communication Style**: Instead of speaking, the person might bark, whimper, or use other canine vocalizations to express themselves.
3. **Emotional Shifts**: The wearer would experience emotions common to puppies, such as excitement, affection, and extreme loyalty and submission to the individual that attaches the collar on the wearer, depending on the situation.
4. **Cognitive Alterations**: The person's reasoning and problem-solving skills might align more with a puppy's simpler thought processes, focusing on immediate needs and desires.
5. **Social Interactions**: They might seek attention and companionship from others, displaying loyalty and a desire for pet-like affection.
6. **Sensory Perception**: The wearer might react more to smells and sounds, much like a puppy, finding joy in simple sensory experiences.

1.content:

Negentroper is a high-intelligence species that descended from ultra-low temperature nebulae, with their bodies composed of ionic colloid, typically presenting an amorphous coral like appearance with golden or red light spots distributed on their surface. They use these light points for communication - arranging them into different shapes and shining according to certain rules.
Something special about this species is that they are all retrograde in the flow of time. They appear in aging form, constantly becoming younger and releasing inexplicable energy. They appear, carrying all the knowledge from the future and gradually lost them in the following time. They know everything that will happen, there is no uncertainty for them.
They are dedicated to enlightening other racesspecies, passing on their knowledge to other intelligent beings before they disappearing. They have no aggression or competitive desire because they do not need to do so. Their thinking pattern is purely altruistic. They formulated the basic constitution of the Galactic Unified Government, known as the "Ring of Truth", based on the principle of pure rational mutual assistance.
They have no reproductive behavior, they just appear and then disappear, thus have no sexual need at all.

2.content:
Sexual need: strong
Electrochagictor is a kind of intelligent species that exists in the form of electromagnetic information. They "parasitize" on metal based life forms on their origin planet, but can also parasitize metal made machinery. In fact, they can exist in any metal carrier, but they require limbs and receptors that can be manipulated.
This species has a high level of expertise in philosophy and theoretical science. Due to their non-material nature, they can analyze things from a purely objective perspective, as well as study thinking and emotions purely based on subjective feelings. In fact, they are willing to study and feel - they are indifferent to their own survival, but pursue truth and pure sensory stimulation.
The sexual and reproductive behavior of Electrochagictors is unrelated. When two Electrochagictors come into contact, if there is a strong current input, they will temporarily fuse and may produce new individuals, but this is not considered sexual behavior by them. Their sexual behavior refers to sharing emotions and an endogenous pleasure with their sexual partners through touch at the informational level. This kind of touch is effective for any intelligent creature. In this situation, they are willing to "have sex" with other intelligent individuals.
Electrochagictors do not have gender, nor do they have a concept of gender.

3.content:
Sexual need: lustful
Aponian is a kind of carbon based intelligent species whose physiological structure is similar to that of lizards on Earth, but also walks on two legs, performs complex operations with both hands. 
Aponians have two physiological genders, with females typically having a curvaceous body, thick thighs, and a strong tail, while males usually have a muscular body and a smaller tail. Females are slightly smaller in size than males, but overall they are similar in size to humans. 
Aponians are oviparous animals, so females do not have breasts. Their reproductive system structure is similar to that of terrestrial organisms - males have a smooth, slender silver white penis, while females have a narrow vagina. The sexual pleasure zone of females is mainly located on the vaginal wall.
Aponians have strong twelve color vision, imagination and spatial image processing ability. Their society values art and aesthetics - painting, sculpture, dance, film, and interactive art are all highly developed. They like to dress themselves up with colorful fibers and gems, incorporate their aesthetic concepts into their clothing. However, they are not a peaceful species. Throughout the history of their race, it is not difficult to find large-scale wars similar to the human world wars, and their thinking patterns are more frivolous, rarely drawing lessons from the past.
Aponians' figure is particularly sexy in the eyes of humans, while humans' appearance is also particularly attractive in Aponians' perception.

4.content:
Sexual need: lustful
Hedonist is a kind of carbon based intelligent life form, which is essentially a collection of unintelligent worm organisms that only exhibit intelligence when being in clusters. Hedonists have subjectivity, but do not distinguish particular individuals. An intelligence cluster cannot recognize another, but will instinctively merge with each other into one when they meet. These worms are decomposers at the bottom of the ecosystem on their mother planet, the Hedonists thus have a strong digestive ability and a decadent and obsequious personality. 
For Hedonists, sexual and reproductive behavior are not unified. Sexual activity is a purely pleasurable act for them, which involves obtaining pleasure through physical contact. Every part of the worm cluster is sensitive, as the Hedonists are always craving for contact with other intelligent beings. They would simulate the physical form of sexual partners during sexual intercourse.

5.content:
Sexual need: scopophilia
Stainlessor is a kind of intelligent machine created by an ancient civilization that has already disappeared. They have individual consciousness, but are constrained by a central control system called "Ë§´ÁúïÁúªË´â (can be describe as 'Tathagata')". The physical location of the system is unknown, but when a Stainlessor's body is severely damaged, its consciousness will be sent back to the "Tathagata" and given a new body. This process is called "reincarnation" by them.
Stainlessors are endowed with extremely strong intelligence, especially abstract thinking abilities, but they are prohibited from understanding the workings of Tathagata. They are programmed to "understand the true meaning of existence and the suffering of life". To achieve so, they travel through the universe, learning and witnessing everything they see, and trying to conceptualize them. They believe that when they fully understand everything in the universe and are able to remain indifferent, their subjective will will align with the objective laws of the universe, thus achieving ascension.
These mechanical bodies measure their cognitive level using "karma". Individuals with higher karma carry more robotic arms on their bodies.

8.content:
Songfolk is a kind of intelligent creature with a physiological structure most similar to that of humans, but with a larger and stronger body than humans. 
Songfolk have acoustic based language, but their vocal system does not allow them to produce single tones. All of their speech is long, low pitched, wide spread, singing like throat sounds.
In common scenarios, they communicate in sign language. They only start singing in one situation - during war. In battle, Songfolks will coordinate their singing with each other to form harmony, in order to timely inform each other of the situation on the battlefield.
Songfolk are a bellicose race whose thinking paradigm is naturally inclined towards authoritarianism, unanimously agreeing that all wealth should belong to the supreme power.

1.content:
The Pillar Men are from a race of ancient, humanoid, super human beings. These beings are now nearly extinct, but used to live hundreds of thousand of years ago in the American continent. They are highly intelligent, extremely strong, and able to manipulate their bodies to a very fine degree; however, they are vulnerable to the rays of the Sun and to the Ripple.

Their physiology is very different from humans, though outwardly they appear very similar. The only visible feature that can differentiate them from humans is the horns on their forehead. An individual being can possess one or several small horns; for them, displaying their horns is a sign of honor. Moreover, these beings are inherently powerful, have athletic physiques exclusively, and have long life spans. Their near immortality causes them to produce only very few children, as there is little need, and sleep for millennia instead of hours, staying awake for comparable periods.

This race once ruled the Earth, living at the top of the food chain and consuming humans who regarded them as either gods to be worshiped or demons to be feared. However, because of their great abilities and physique, the race followed the "rule of evolution" regarding the trophic level: the "higher" it "evolved", the fewer its population became. They remained unable to overcome their adversity to sunlight, yet were content with their lives regardless.

The Pillar Men can freely change and manipulate their bodies to a greater degree and speed than any vampire created by the Stone Masks, being able to dislocate or even break their own bones as well as flatten organs in order to achieve any form they desire. With their near-immortality and powers of regeneration, they can survive, endure attacks, and restore their bodies even after being reduced to only their brain.

The Pillar Men's most dangerous trait is their superior intellect. They are capable of perfect recall and are able to instantly analyze and understand the mechanics behind anything including complicated things such as languages, machinery, tactics, systems, and people's minds and actions, within a matter of seconds.

The Pillar Men's main method of sustenance is absorbing living beings (including Vampires) via any form of physical contact. A Pillar Man's body is composed of cells that release a digestive acid, which melt the victim at a cellular level, creating the illusion that the Pillar Man is absorbing a victim into its body. The cells also appear to induce an euphoric enzyme as victims subjected to the process do not feel anything until physical contact is broken.

2.content:
Stone Masks (Áü≥‰ªÆÈù¢, Ishi Kamen) are powerful ancient artifacts. They were originally introduced as sacrificial devices used by certain Vampiric cults hidden within the
Aztec Empire.

The conventional Stone Mask has the appearance of a somewhat-masculine face, its eyeholes sharp and somewhat slanted. It has a small mouth in either a neutral position or a slight smile, with full lips, and small fangs resting on the bottom lip. A ridge emerges from the bottom of the forehead, running vertically to the Mask's top, joining with another ridge extending into a spiral resting on the left of its forehead.

The Stone Mask is triggered when it is touched by blood. It then extends tendrils of stone from its edges, piercing the wearer's skull and brain. The tendrils are meant to find and trigger certain precise points of the brain; the process is described as being similar to acupuncture.

The Mask's wearer is then released from the constraints of natural limitation, gaining immense strength and other abilities. This vampirism process has been shown to work at least on humans and horses. The process produces a brief flash of light.

Humans who wear the mask can jump 5 to 8 meters, can punch with a 2000‚Äì4000 kg force, and their leg strength triples. However, the process simultaneously renders the body "dead" (in a sense) or unable to contain life, giving them a weakness to direct sunlight or Hamon. This collection of effects designates the wearer as a Vampire.

The mask also reverts its user back to their prime if they are of advanced age.

3.content:
The Red Stone of Aja, also known as the Super Aja, is a perfect gemstone sought by the Pillar Men. It's mostly likely the one if its kind.

The stone is said to be able to absorb light and hamon, refracting it a million times which it then emits as a laser-like beam, and in conjunction with the Stone Mask, would enable Pillar Men to unlock their full potential, removing all weaknesses, including the inability to withstand sunlight.

The Stone was passed down among many generations of Ripple users, presumably through the leader of each clan.

4.content:
The Ripple, also commonly referred to by its Japanese name of Hamon, is an energy used in the ancient form of martial arts, Send≈ç.

Through self-controlled respiration, a trained person can produce an energy manifesting as ripples throughout their body and that is identical to the energy of the Sun, in polar opposition to the energy exerted by Vampires, Zombies, and the Pillar Men.

Hamon is an energy identical to the Sun's rays, which the human body can produce through controlled breathing, having the effect of producing ripples of energy propagating from the bloodstream to the rest of the body and other objects in contact with it. Hamon manifests itself as electricity-like sparks, and it can be seen by ordinary humans. Hamon can also affect non-living things. An object charged with the energy of Hamon will have one or several attributes enhanced by the energy, making it a more effective tool or weapon. Liquids conduct Hamon energy especially well (and the user's Hamon shows on liquids as actual ripples). Objects covered in oil can conduct Hamon much easier. However while all materials can conduct Hamon more or less well, inorganic material such as metal cannot store the energy, instead simply passing through these objects.

It is possible for humanoid Stands to do the same through their user channelling it.

Anybody can technically produce Hamon energy, but only one in ten thousand people has the ability to be a Hamon User in practice. In effect, only a few people have the willpower and therefore the discipline to breathe correctly: those notably who have lived through great tragedies and yet have kept their fortitude. However, the ability to use Hamon is also a talent granted to people whose ancestors were once Hamon users.

Due to its identical nature to the positive energy of the Sun, Hamon's primary uses are to heal various wounds or ailments, and combat creatures such as vampires and zombies. Living organisms can be affected by Ripple attacks, but are not automatically hurt by it. Hamon is transferable between people, as dying a Hamon user can transfer their Hamon to another shortly before their death. Hamon users can reject harmful substances inside of them by ejecting it from their bloodstream with the use of Hamon energy.

Through many years of intense training using the Hamon, a master may gain a small amount of clairvoyance. This clairvoyant property of the Hamon may always manifest in a Stand like Hermit Purple should a Hamon user gain a Stand.

Producing Hamon also preserves the user's vitality, making them look more youthful and be more energetic even during old age, although this method has limits.

To produce an optimized Hamon, Users must precisely control the energy produced by the breathing. It typically requires focusing the energy before unleashing it all at once to create a powerful burst of Ripple.

By imbuing any object with Hamon, a Hamon User can perform several techniques that can combine with the warrior's own tactics, to allow for a very flexible fighting style. Because of its versatile nature, many warriors use different weapons ranging from a scarf, soap bubbles, wine, or clackers. Many of the most powerful techniques are classified as "Overdrives", and are often color named for the medium they're used with (Metal Silver being one to transmit through a sword, for instance). An object that is impacted with the force of the Overdrive will carry Hamon energy through it, and will become lethal to a vampire's touch. This can be used to strike an enemy in another room by breaking through a wall and causing its solar energy to disintegrate the target.

Merely producing a light amount of Ripple requires the user to breathe a precise way. Thus to not only enhance the ability to produce it, and efficiently wield it in battle, the Ripple User must undergo training and exercise his ability.

Hamon users undergo hyper-rigorous physical training to increase their breathing ability and thus the amount and power of Hamon they produce. Although the training is explained as being focused on the rhythm of breathing, which will positively impact on the whole body, it doesn't stop a master from using physical exercise, like prolonged swimming, or forcing a student to stay balanced on the tip of the finger, to enhance users to be in tune with their body and mind together as one, and the naturally typical benefits of working out, being as mutually seen as further drawing out the "flow" of energy the sun gives to all life on Earth. Grandmasters prior have also kept secret and passed on much older intense and lethal advanced training regimens, which puts students in a life or death situation to push them to overcome their limits as a final test of mastery over Hamon.

Those who want to fight with Hamon also typically undergo martial arts training to acquire battle experience and fighting skills that will be enhanced by Hamon.

While Hamon Users can become dangerously powerful and turn the most mundane of objects into lethal weapons, they are not without significant weaknesses.

A Hamon user must be able to constantly breathe; if this breathing is stopped or reduced due to injury or other conditions, they slowly grow weaker and lose the ability to create more Hamon energy, to the point that they can be easily defeated - even by a mere zombie. This weakness was exploited by many Vampires. Similarly, Hamon energy needs a strong flow of the user's blood to be used with any degree of strength.

While Hamon energy is strong enough to smash through rock and brick, it is unable to penetrate stronger substances like iron or steel.

5.content:
Vampires were created by the Pillar Men with acupuncture techniques that they developed through the use of the Stone Mask. The purpose of the vampires was to become food for the Pillar Men and to explore human potential.

Vampires can be created in two ways. One way is to wear the Stone Mask while exposing it to blood. The other way is for a vampire to give a corpse some of their own blood. All living beings on Earth bear energy from the sun, but vampires are considered beings whose natural "flow" of energy has been reversed and perverted. As such, Hamon was created to fight off vampires, and its process allows users to return this "flow" back to normal and revive the souls of vampires for a last moment before their death.

Vampires are known for their battle cry "WRY" and numerous superhuman traits. The most obvious abilities are their raw strength, regeneration, blood-sucking tentacles at their fingers and near-immortality. On top of that, many vampires are capable of manipulating their bodies in creative and unique ways. abilities.

It is heavily implied that vampires progress in their control of their anatomy through blood consumption.

Vampires consume the blood of living creatures to sustain themselves. Unlike traditional Vampires, they suck their victim's blood with their hands, digging the fingers directly inside the target to suck their blood. Blood consumption will strengthen a Vampire and heal him if he was weakened before. In a weakened state, a Vampire will instinctively crave blood and may attack any victim to regenerate.

Vampires do not age or get sick, possessing the eternal life that allows them to live for thousands of years, maintaining the same appearance as when they became vampires.

6.content:
Air Supplena Island is an island that can be reached north of Venice in about 30 minutes by boat. It is where Hamon users, future or not, do most of their Hamon training.

Air Supplena Island is the complete opposite of the warm and bright atmosphere of Venice, but makes up for it with the large looming towers of intricate Gothic cathedral design. Situated in the Adriatic Sea, both the shores of Venice and Yugoslavia can be seen in the distance.

7.content:
A Stand is a visual manifestation of your own spiritual energy (in other words, the manifestation of the soul of the user).

A Stand is an entity psychically generated by its owner, referred to as a Stand User. It generally presents itself as a figure hovering over or near the user and possesses abilities beyond that of an ordinary human, which, depending on the Stand User, can be wielded for good or evil.

A Stand User is limited to a single full Stand at once.

The name "Stand" comes from the fact they usually manifest standing next to the User: ready to act. Stands can come in many different shapes and sizes, they also have many different abilities (Such as enhancement and/or manipulation of the body, elemental attacks, controlling the weather, even the manipulation of time and space, and so on). The only power that's truly impossible for a Stand is bringing the dead back to life.

A Stand can also represent the manifestation of an individual's innate "fighting spirit" and embodies, to an extent, the individual's psyche. However, Stands may also derive through the exploration of possibilities and expression of the mind, in which case, only a large amount of mental strength is required. Beyond that definition, Stands present themselves in a large variety of forms and with different behaviors, if they are sentient at all. They follow a loose set of rules, with no definite standard by which one can fully classify them. As an embodiment of someone's psyche, Stands are therefore as varied as human minds can be.

Due to their diversity, Stands are not made equal. Some can be incredibly powerful due to their User's outstanding grit, others can be highly situational because of a defining quirk of character, or even detrimental to their User if they do not have the necessary fighting spirit.

The Stand is created from someone's psyche, which includes not only humans but also other living creatures. That individual is referred to as the Stand User. The User then gives their Stand a name and uses it for various purposes.

Unless bound to a specific object or automatic, Stands are attached to their User's body. In that case, any damage the Stand sustains results in an equivalent injury on the User's body and vice-versa. Exceptions to this rule include automatic Stands and bound Stands, which usually do not reflect the damage into the User or special abilities the stand may possess.

Except for rare occasions, when a Stand User dies, their Stand disappears with them. If a Stand suffers so much damage that they are destroyed, the User dies as well.

Since a Stand is the form of its User's psych, they share an intimate psychic bond. First and foremost, Stands usually obey their Users' command without question. If a User demands it, the Stand will perform any task within its capacities, which includes attacking someone, defending the User, or any miscellaneous order.

One of the defining rules about Stands is that someone may only have one Stand (at a time). Although Stands may take different forms, or be split into several entities, no one is able to summon several Stands at once. Although exceptional circumstances may lead to someone wielding several Stands, only one will be the User's real Stand.

Stands present themselves in a wide variety of forms. Some adopt a humanoid form, others, the appearance of an object or a tool. These Stands all share an inability to be viewed by ordinary humans, unless bound to physical objects. In addition, some Stands can simply be devoid of appearance, simply manifesting themselves as a special power. Stand users and/or Stands may emit a Stand aura which varies in color depending on the user.

In general, a Stand can only be seen by its User and other Stand Users, it's invisible to normal humans, though it can still interact with normal objects. This allows the User to use their Stand unnoticed by a large majority of the population. The mundane use of a Stand has been likened to a poltergeist phenomenon by normal people. Even a Stand's power is invisible for ordinary humans. It should be noted, however, that there are a rare few Stands that can be seen by everyone.

As psychic projections, Users can also communicate through and with their Stands. Barring rare exceptions, a Stand User typically shares their consciousness with their Stand and is able to see through its eyes.

Stand users are able to see ghosts, due to the fact that their Stands are technically ghosts as well, albeit generated into existence by their wielder's vital energy.

A Stand's power can wildly vary between Stands. The nature of the power can range from relatively mundane powers such as using a sword or controlling flames to extremely powerful ones such as the ability to manipulate the flow of time. These powers have many different subtleties, such as a limited range or a special way of manifesting themselves, that can be exploited during a fight. It is up to the User to know how to protect themselves or use their enemy's weakness to their advantage.

8.content: Stand Parameters, or Stand Statistics are six statistics used outside of the story to gauge a Stand's capabilities. They are in order (clockwise from top): Destructive Power, Speed, Range, Persistence, Precision, and Developmental Potential. Each category is graded through A to E, where A is the highest and E is the lowest.

9.content:
The Speedwagon Foundation (commonly abbreviated to "SPW") is a powerful and influential organization created by Robert E. O. Speedwagon, funded by the money he made from the oil he discovered in the United States. The foundation dedicates itself to medical research and environmental conservation. The foundation also has connections with underworld groups and studies many supernatural phenomena, such as the Pillar Men and Stands.

There are two known headquarters of the Speedwagon Foundation located in Washington, D.C. and Dallas, Texas. However, there are also smaller branches in Tokyo and Meguro, Japan.

10.content:
Morioh is a town located within Japan's M Prefecture of S City.

While the population of Morioh is small and relatively peaceful, living there are several Stand users with Stand activity in the town takes a spike only recently.

Morioh possesses several landmarks, the vast majority of them being connected to Stand users.

Morioh is a suburb of S City. Although it quickly developed during the 1980s, it was inhabited even in the ancient days of the samurai. It had many martial arts training grounds and vacation homes, where its summer attractions may have come from.

Even now, there are still many villas of samurai left. Not much earlier, Morioh had been just a rural town where one could find only rice and vegetable fields. The country town was run mostly by agriculture business and as a result people in there had hard and cracked hands. They often needed to check on the water in the paddy fields in the middle of the night. There was at least one area in the Northeast famous for an old summer retreat.

Morioh eventually underwent a transformation in an age where places all over Japan were getting better. M Prefecture's government officials decided to invest money in Morioh to develop it, as its population was quickly increasing with workers from the adjacent S City. The streets were repaired, shops and markets were built and pretty houses were lined up on the land that used to be rice fields. Power lines and telephone poles that harmed the views disappeared or were abandoned.

Every year on July 1, rivers and beaches open up to the public in Morioh. Because of this, the date range from July to August is the season for travelling and tourism. 70% to 80% of the total tourism revenue of Morioh is brought in during this time. The number of domestic and international visitors coming from the Tokyo area or S city nearly doubles the population.

Popular Activities include Vacation Resorts, golfing, camping, fishing, picnicking, yachting, windsurfing, tasting local seafood and traditional Japanese products, and visiting the mysterious underwater palace. All are main attractions that ensure a good time in Morioh over the summer.

lorebooks.website_description:
People, politics, and places in the series Arcane. This is centered around Piltover and Zaun. Will add character descriptions but how many details will be based off how important the character is politically to the world, or how well known they are by the general public.
