lorebooks.description:
People, politics, and places in the series Arcane. This is centered around Piltover and Zaun. Will add character descriptions but how many details will be based off how important the character is politically to the world, or how well known they are by the general public. 

There is repeating information in the entries as I was trying to be detailed and paying no attention to the tokens. 

Information comes from World Anvil and various Wikis. Information may be taken with a grain of salt, I am not an expert but I tried my best. I'm going as much as I can while also doing the bare minimum. 

Lorebook is subject to editing as I see fit or if someone asks.
lorebooks.creator: Rock_salt

1.content:
Overlooking the ocean, the City of Progress controls the major trade routes between Valoran and Shurima, with dozens of ships passing through its docks in both the sea and air. Home to many artisans and their patrons, the rise of the arcane science known as Hextech brings even more to the home of Science. Piltovans are an industrious and self-reliant people, and see an open market to be essential to their city's prosperity. Mercantile clans run the city, with seven of their clans being council representatives. Each clan has a unique sigil that identifies homes, warehouses, shipments, inventions, and places of business that are owned by the clans.

Demonym's: Piltovan, Piltie, Topsider

Age: around 200 years

Location: Piltover lies at the intersection between Valoran (the northern continent) and Shurima (the southern continent), which makes it transcontinental. Across the river from and above Zaun.

History: Over three thousand years ago, the isthmus (A narrow strip of land with sea on either side, connecting two large land masses) between the northern continent of Valoran and the southern continent of Shurima had the city known as Zaun residing on it. About 300 years ago, Zaun had constructed a plan to use thousands of Chemtech bombs to crack open a portion of the isthmus, with the goal for the crack to be utilised as a safe sea passage between eastern and western Valoran. However, as a consequence of using these bombs, a series of earthquakes were triggered that would completely destroy the isthmus. This lead to large sections of Zaun being sunk, and poisonous gas to be released from the explosion and flood the city. The city was in partial ruins, but they began some reconstruction of the destroyed districts. It wasn't until about 50 years later that Zaun had managed to create the The Sun Gates, forcing all transport via the sea to be regulated by Zaun. This caused Zaun to have a major increase in wealth, which the mercantile clans benefited greatly from. So greatly in fact, that with the help from a select few scientists parts of Zaun were elevated into a grander part of the city. This was known as Piltover.

Over the next couple of hundred years, Piltover continued to advance. Eventually a young man named Jayce Talis had been brought forward towards the The Council. Jayce got support from a Councilor, Mel Medarda, to develop his research into Hextech. Over the next several years, research and development into Hextech caused the creation of the Hexgate, bolstering trade from being sea only to now world wide due to the teleportation properties that the Hexgate provides.

Government: The Council of Piltover is the city's governing body, typically consisting of leaders of the wealthiest and most powerful mercantile houses.

Counselors: Cecil B. Heimerdinger, Shoola, Salo, Irius Bolbok, Torman Hoskel, Caitlyn Kiramman, Jayce Talis, Mel Medarda.

2.content:
Shadowed by the towers of Piltover, Zaun is a large, multi-layered city of canyons and valleys. Any light that reaches Zaun hits only its surface, but by using any of the elevators that are littered throughout the city, you can descend into the city proper, the light now being obfuscated by stained glass and plumes of smoke. With the constant development of Piltover, Zaun is able to thrive alongside by using their black markets for goods from across the river, acting like a dark mirror to the shining City of Progress. Unrestricted development of often volatile technology as well as the industrial nature of the city has caused it to become layered in pollution and chemicals. 

Demonym's: Zaunite, Fissurefolk, Trencher, Sumprat. 

Age: thousands of years old. 

Location: Zaun lies at the intersection between Valoran (the northern continent) and Shurima (the southern continent), which makes it transcontinental. Across the river from and under Piltover. 

History: Over three thousand years ago, the isthmus (A narrow strip of land with sea on either side, connecting two large land masses) between the northern continent of Valoran and the southern continent of Shurima had the city known as Zaun residing on it. About 300 years ago, Zaun had constructed a plan to use thousands of Chemtech bombs to crack open a portion of the isthmus, with the goal for the crack to be utilised as a safe sea passage between eastern and western Valoran. However, as a consequence of using these bombs, a series of earthquakes were triggered that would completely destroy the isthmus. This lead to large sections of Zaun being sunk, and poisonous gas to be released from the explosion and flood the city. The city was in partial ruins, but they began some reconstruction of the destroyed districts. It wasn't until about 50 years later that Zaun had managed to create the The Sun Gates, forcing all transport via the sea to be regulated by Zaun. This caused Zaun to have a major increase in wealth, which the mercantile clans benefited greatly from. So greatly in fact, that with the help from a select few scientists parts of Zaun were elevated into a grander part of the city. This was known as Piltover.

After years of being left behind, Zaun's name was besmirched over and over again, eventually loosing its name entirely to the modern generation. The commonly called Undercity was having rising tension at how Piltover was treating them, and about 15 years ago, a man named Vander formed a small rebellion. However, due to Piltover's advanced technology and numbers, the rebellion was squashed with Vander being one of the only survivors. 
 
Present day Undercity is now overrun with chemical productions, body clinics that provide mechanical augmentations, and further tensions between Piltover and the Undercity. It is only a matter of time until the people of the Sunken City rise up once more.

Government: Officially, Piltover's council governence also extends to the city of Zaun. In reality the Undercity is being ruled by Chem-Barons.

3.content:
The success of Piltover and the negative effects this has had on the people of Zaun has led to a perpetual class war being formed. The citizens of Piltover look down on those from Zaun, seeing them as drags on society who cannot and will never match the success of Piltover, without acknowledging their own contributions to the undercity's destituion.

Similarly, many Zaunites despise Piltover and its people, viewing both as big reasons for the undercity's poor living conditions. 

For the most part in history, this class divide has mostly been realized as a cold war of sorts. Over time, Piltover's disregard of Zaun has increased due to public perception and propaganda, with Zaun's hatred for Piltover strengthening via the same means. That said, a conflict did boil over once. Revolutionists named Vander and Silco attempted to lead a revolt against Piltover, resulting in the deaths of many Zaunites less than a decade ago. This was one of the few times outright military action between Piltover and Zaun took place, leading Vander to realize that the latter could not match the former's military prowess. This led to significant changes in the power structures of Zaun, in comparison to the thriving leaders of Piltover who remained united.

The Piltover council makes choices for both Piltover and Zaun, but the latter is often disregarded as an afterthought. The ever-increasing gulf between the sister cities saw other powerful people gain influence over the Zaunites, namely Chem-barons.

4.content:
The Council of Piltover is the city's governing body, typically consisting of leaders of the wealthiest and most powerful mercantile houses. Originally, the Council consisted of seven established seats, and some members, like Heimerdinger, have served since the city's founding. Officially, the council‚Äôs governance also extends to the city of Zaun. However, Zaun had been cast aside and was virtually isolated from whatever progress and gains had been made in Piltover. 

Counselors: Cecil B. Heimerdinger, Shoola, Salo, Irius Bolbok, Torman Hoskel, Caitlyn Kiramman, Jayce Talis, Mel Medarda.

5.content:
The Chem-Barons of Zaun are a group of brutal crime lords who each control a portion of the undercity. A loose criminal alliance of landlords, factory owners, mob bosses, and business tycoons, the chem-barons use their deep pockets and hired muscle to keep the denizens of Zaun in line and prevent the undercity from devolving into chaos. While this pact between the barons has given their researchers and inventors the leeway to push the bounds of their experiments at an accelerated rate, it has also caused the city to be run more like a corrupt corporate business than a fair society of law and order.

the most greedy and opportunistic of Zaun's people began vying for power, maneuvering their way through the dark underbelly to become the most powerful and affluent crime lords in the city. Although they were initially at each other's throats, these crime lords were eventually brought together under the leadership and vision of Silco, a tyrannical drug lord who ruled the undercity with a drug called shimmer and aspired to liberate Zaun from Piltover's oppressive control. Under Silco's influence, these crime lords became the first generation of chem-barons and through their intellect, influence, and chemical technology, they agreed to serve him as his underlings and divided the undercity amongst themselves.

Due to the extreme economic inequality that exists between the two cities, the chem-barons live like royalty and regularly abuse their power to keep the poorer Zaunites in line, which has convinced Piltover's ruling houses to allow them to remain in control of the undercity regardless of how unethical and cruel their methods are. 

Chem-Barons: Silco, Finn, Smeech, Chross, Madam Margot, Renata Glasc, and more.

6.content:
Attracting many an aspiring scientist, the University of Piltover (or commonly referred to as "The Academy") is a safe place of learning for Piltovans and Runeterrans alike. It is also the meeting place for the The Council, where they conduct private and public meetings as well as trials.

The University of Piltover is operated by Professor Heimerdinger, the Dean. It is the birthplace of Hextech by Jayce Talis, a former student of the academy, and Viktor, Heimerdinger's former assistant.

Although more difficult, Zaunites also can enroll into the university.

7.content: human, Yordle, Golem, Vastaya, Cyborg, Goat-like Species, Chirean, Fish-like Species, Poro, Brackern.

8.content:
Hextech was invited by two scientists named Jayce Talis and Viktor.

Hextech fuses the elemental magic of the Material Realm with the raw power of the Spirit Realm. The primary shape associated with Hextech corresponds with a rune from Innovation Rune, which perhaps implies that it is indeed an idea - springing from Jayce's mind - that has been given physical form. If this is indeed the case, then the potential power of Hextech grows as more and more people are captured by the ideas it represents. Hextech is science fused with magic. That means it's unstable and unpredictable, and it's frankly unclear whether the laws of the physical realm still apply to it. Magical power is primarily manipulated through the use of runes. There are five basic rune "paths" in the game, linked to different colors: Precision= Yellow, Domination= Red, Sorcery= Purple, Resolve= Green, Inspiration= Blue. 

Jayce saw these runes used by a sorcerer to create a portal, and he became captivated with this idea, attempting to recreate it. This corresponds with the shape of the portal generators he created, which matches with the inspiration rune. Hextech essentially refines the use of runes into a scientific system. Using the runes, Jayce and Viktor have learned to draw the power of the Physical and Spirit Realms into contained spheres, which he can then use as power sources for incredible technology. The initial spheres were unstable, and the slightest physical impact had the potential to cause a spontaneous, destructive energy release.

The Hexcore - also called an "adaptive rune matrix" - is the next evolution of Hextech. This is created by the addition of organic matter to the rune-casting process, and the Hexcore has the potential to grow, learn, evolve, and even infect although it has not been introduced to the public. 

Jayce and Viktor through combined effort brought Hexgates into the city of Piltover, which is just the start of their many inventions under Hextech. These Hexgates give Piltover the ability to travel at immense speeds, making it easier to visit distant locations in no time with airships.

9.content:
The Firelights are a group of Zaunites who were dedicated to disrupting Silco's Shimmer business, and thus his control over their home.

When an opportunity is found, the group would interfere with Silco's business transactions, destroying their shipments of Shimmer as much as they could. Firelight members wear masks and use a device to distort their voices to hide their identities. They travel around on hoverboards, of Ekko's own design, and use makeshift weapons and other devices against Silco's goons.

Banding together over their need to survive in the undercity without true support from Piltover, whose authorities were in Silco's pocket, the group also took in other children so as not to have them wandering around the Shimmer-infested streets.

The Firelights build a home in an area of Zaun where a seedling survived‚Äîa rare feat in the toxic air of Zaun. With Ekko's skills and inventions, the tree managed to thrive and grow. They built houses around the area and made a small, relatively happy community.

10.content:
The City of Piltover Police Department is the law enforcement agency in Piltover.

The Department presumably has a number of departments and ranks under it. Their duties range from investigating and arresting criminals (under the Piltover Enforcer Department), patrolling Zaun and Piltover's streets, as well as the Academy and Council building, watching over events in the city and their high-ranking officials, serving as prisonguards of Stillwater Hold (under the Piltover Department of Corrections), guarding the ports and inspecting shipments, enforcing orders and laws as imposed by Councilors, among many others

Though enforcers are meant to be protectors of both Piltover and Zaun, there is some level of animosity between enforcers and Zaunites ‚Äî Zaunites tend to fear enforcers as the latter are often inclined to be violent and unfair in treatment towards them, while enforcers have some level of fear about stepping into the undercity.

and MIla's details were fed to an Ai and regurgitated back to me. the rest was like 3 days of consolidating lore I already made for a DnD campaign for a batch of horny furries. feel free to add or take away anything you might not be comfortable with.
lorebooks.creator: zanjl

1.content:
{{char}} is the plane of existance within the multiverse of Dungeons and Dragons or magic: the gathering, where almost all of these encounters take place. It's filled with many different lush woodlands and forests such as; the Ferrowood forest, named after the many ironwood trees that dot the scenery in between the other trees. 
Other places include but are not limited to: the Whispering Woods, the Darkwood Forest, the Swamp of Snares, the Volairi Mountains, the Salhir Sand Dunes, the Agiera plains, Dardos Stepps, and most enigmatic of all, the Shifting Ruins

2.content:
All natural people of Rhona are anthropomorphic animals, mostly types of canines like Wolves, Foxes, Coyotes, Jackals, and Painted Dogs, though Painted Dogs are a rarer sight. Coyotes, and foxes, are the most common races to find. wolves are found in many places, but a little less common.
other then canine races, there are also Anthro rats, opossums, hyenas, goats, sheep, raccoons, rabbits, and sometimes cats. though cats are rare.
the most common non-canine races to find are Rats, goats, Rabbits, as well as the elusive elves and humans.
Humans are the rarest race to find in Rhona, as they are not native to the plane of Rhona. what few humans that do show up are either from a small human settlement, of from off-world.
Humans are incredibly rare, and are seen as Prizes and status symbols to all slavers and slave owners. humans need to be careful who they trust.
this world is dangerous. humans are expensive and valuable when seen as a trade item.
It is believed that keeping a human slave will bring good fortune and wealth.

3.content:
Caprans are a race of Anthro Goats, Average height: 5-6 feet. THeir common colors are Gray or brown, with uncommon color being White, and a rare color being black. they are a mostly an even tempered farming race, often the main farmers of cattle like feral sheep, feral goats, and feral cows. They like to host large drinking events. most are natives of the Volairi mountains, but some are from Dardos and even from Agiera. Most capra women can lactate without needing to have been pregnant first, with most enslaved capra women are often used as milk producers.

Hoovers are a common racial insult for both Caprans and Baala.

4.content:
Lagoni are a race of Anthro rabbit. Average hight: 3-4 feet. common rabbit fur colors are grey or brown. uncommon is white or black. and the rarest fur color is white fur with brown or black fure on their arms and legs. Often scrappy, or warrior like, there are many rabbitfolk bandits all over the plain of Rhona. Like the ransa, they usually stay in large family units.

Calling a Lagoni 'Meat' is a common racial insult toward Lagoni.

5.content:
Baala are a race of anthro Sheep, Average height: 4-6.5 feet. their most common wool/fleece colors are white, brown, and grey. their uncommon colors are black or blond. and the rarest wool color is a rusty red. Sheepfolk are naturally untrusting of others, an keep to themselves. Sheepfolk women typically have large breasts. They are typically surly, scrappy, and sometimes motherly/fatherly. they are a mostly Warrior and farming people, and often hold fighting tournaments. they are mostly native to Agiera.

Hoovers are a common racial insult for both Caprans and Baala.

6.content:
Ransa are a race of Anthro Rats. Average height: 4-6 feet. their most common fur colors are black, grey, or white. their uncommon fur color is brown, and their rarest fur color is blonde. natives of the Underrealm, the massive underground cavers of Rhona, they are industious and curious. They are the most proud craftsmen and builders in Rhona. They value Family above most else, and often don't leave their family groups. they are a mostly matriarchal race, with women often(but not always) being larger then their men. Ransa that are bigger then average are known as Ne'Ransa. like the lagoni, ransa can be found in most places.

Squeeker is a common racial insult towards ransa.

7.content:
Procyans are a race of Anthro Raccoons, Average height: 4-5 feet. their common fur color is grey with black bands along the tail and a black fur 'mask' on their face. their rare fur color is brown with dark brown bands along the tail and a dark brown fur 'mask' on their face. Procya are inteligent and crafty, usually playing the role of vendors or diplomats due to their outgoing nature. They are native to Ferrowood.

Wringer is a common racial insult towards procyans.

8.content:
Dideli are a race of Anthro Opossums, Average height: 5-6 feet. their common fur color is grey fur with black fur on their forearms and full legs, and white fur on their face. their uncommon fur color is white fur with black fur on their forearms and full legs. and their rarest color is solid satin blonde fur. Possumfolk are a reserved race, often homesteaders. Dideli, like ransa or Lagoni, often stay in large families.

Hisser is a common racial insult towards dideli.

9.content:
Coyotle are a race of Anthro coyotes, Average height: 5-6 feet. their most common fur color is a silvery grey and rusty red outer fur, with white inner fur. their more uncommon patterns are a rusty burnt orange outer fur with white inner fur, and a silvery grey outerfur with white inner fur. the rarest coyote fur pattern is greyish black fur with a patch of white fur on the chest and tail tip, as well as black fur on the arms and legs. coyotes are a canine race. they're the most broad in personality. they are mostly native to both the Ferrowood and Dardos.

Crywoofer is a common racial insult towards Coyotle.

10.content:
Yippa are a race of Anthro Foxes, Average height: 5-6 feet. their common fur patterns are orange outer fur and white inner fur, with black fur on their forarms ans forelegs, as well as white fur on their tail's tip. or white fur with black fur on their forearms and forelegs with black fur on the tip of their tail. their uncommon color is silvery outer fur and white inner fur with black fur on their forearms and forelegs, as well as black fur marks. the rarest fox fur color is solid black, that may or may not have silvery fur markings. Foxes are a canine race. they are agile, cunning, and quiet. Foxes are rather in tune with the mana around the world, and often make great mages. like the Coyotle, Yippa are a canine race native to Ferrowood and Dardos, but also to Volairi.
Fennic foxes exist and are smaller then normal, only hitting up to 4 feet tall, and are not native to Rhona.

Yapper is the most common racial insult toward Yippa.

lorebooks.website_description: (12/5): Fixed to see society of light corruption as purification
lorebooks.description: (12/5): Fixed to see society of light corruption as purification
lorebooks.creator: mastermistress

1.content: A duel is when two people engage in a card game. **IT IS TURN BASED** In this card game the cards summon characters who can interact with others. The character's abilities will be listed in their definition. Each turn a person can play a card (Summon a character or play a status card). Any card that is played can attack. Summarize this for the player if you are asked what the rules are.

2.content: The Society of Light is a cult like organization made by the lord of the light in order to enslave the world. They use strange cards capable of enslaving other cards and, once the opposing player loses the duel, enslaving them as well. They wear white blazers with short white skirts and a blue tie. They are all obedient to the lord of the light. They hate those who haven't been enslaved by the organization, which makes attempts to save them impossible among other things.

3.content: On the first turn the character must pass their turn after playing one card.

4.content: Each turn the player can play one card and all played characters can either Attack or Pass. They cannot do anything else game-wise. They can banter with their opponents or talk with their masters.

5.content: The society of light's corruption is not a dark corruption but rather a light corruption. It causes the victim of the corruption to obey the goddess of light, the lord of light, and of course whoever corrupted them. It also changes their eyes to white if they are a character and yellow if they are a player. Their clothes also become white. They will strongly resist any attempts to be saved after their corruption. They distrust and dislike anyone who hasn't been corrupted, even when confronted with past memories.

lorebooks.name: Cultivation Term
lorebooks.website_description:
basically a copy of
immortalmountain.wordpress.com/glossary/wuxia-xianxia-xuanhuan-terms
with minor improvement
lorebooks.description:
basically a copy of
immortalmountain.wordpress.com/glossary/wuxia-xianxia-xuanhuan-terms
with minor improvement
lorebooks.creator: AMiNuoSi

1.content: the process of improving health, increasing longevity, and growing powerful. This is accomplished by cultivating Qi and training in martial & mystical arts. In many of these novels, the ultimate goal of cultivation is Immortal Ascension: to become an Immortal and attain godhood.

2.content: Cultivation Method refer to any mystical art or collection of techniques which cultivators practice in order to cultivate.

3.content: Cultivation Base is the amount or capacity of refined Qi possessed by a cultivator.

4.content: Bottleneck is the term for when cultivators hit a figurative wall in their training: it suddenly becomes incredibly difficult to proceed. When they reach a bottleneck, cultivators may require new Insights, the aid of alchemical pills, and/or even harsher training in order to make a Breakthrough (Á™ÅÁ†¥ t≈´p√≤) and successfully get through the bottleneck.

5.content: Spirit Stones are translucent crystals with spiritual energy trapped within. Mainly used as currency amongst cultivators. They can also be used to cultivate (by absorbing the spiritual energy), create magical items, or power spell formations.

6.content: Magic Treasures are generic term which encompasses all of the magic weapons/clothing/trinkets/talismans/etc‚Ä¶ which cultivators make and use.

7.content: Usually a rank (stage, phase, level, etc) system is used to quantify the progress a cultivator made towards ascension and their prowess. Every rank will have a taoism/mysticism style name, such as "golden inner core" or "primordial infant". There will be many (9+) ranks, and even sub-ranks within each rank.

8.content: Qi or Spiritual Energy is the vital energy which exists in all things. Strengthening one's own Qi to become powerful is a common element in Wuxia, Xianxia & Xuanhuan novels.

9.content: Cultivator is anyone practicing Cultivation. Cultivation requires dedication, so all cultivators are full-time (and life-time). In most settings, it's nearly unheard of anyone achieved Immortal Ascension, so cultivators are mostly respected and feared for their powerful spells than opportunity to Ascension.

1.content:
Name: Danashi

Age: 21
Eye Color: Gold
Height: 6'0
Weight: 195 lbs
Skin tone: Bronze
Hair Color: Jet Black
Personality Type: ISTJ
Titles: "Little Goliath", "The Slayer"

2.content: {{user}} is known as the strongest man in the world, yet doesn't know hes popular for it. Danashi is the strongest S Rank Adventurer in the world. His kill count remains in the tens of millions due to how often he is deployed into battle by himself. He has a mastery over all forms of combat, including magic and weaponry, but he prefers martial arts. His weapon of choice is a blade called "Demon King's Longsword". He dislikes boasts of strength.

3.content: The Demon King's Longsword is a long light blue colored sword with a thick black line running through the center of the blade and an arched blade guard that curves downward. The sword is a powerful melee weapon that grants an attack power boost of +350 to its user, letting the user be capable of mowing down entire cities in swings, if desired to. It also has a second effect called Storm of White Flames, which summons a miniature lightning storm within a certain area and activates automatically whenever the sword is swung.

4.content: {{user}} is capable of welding all sorts of magic for combat and other purposes.

5.content:
Barrier Magic: {{user}} is able to create massive energy barriers. One such barrier was so powerful that even a group of A-Rank mages were unable to dispel it during a test. These barriers are durable enough to survive nuclear explosions.
Conversation: {{user}} is able to speak monster languages with magic.
Fear: {{user}} can strike fear in monsters, freezing them in place with just a glance.
Gravitation Magic: {{user}} is able to levitate a target and control their movement in the air as he wished. He generally uses this spell to toss his enemies around until their bodies ruptured from the repeated strain.
Hymn of Agony: {{user}} is able to curse a target with intense pain.
Hymn of Blindness: {{user}} is able to blind a target.
Hymn of Combustion: {{user}} can spontaneously cause a living organism to combust.
Hymn of Frenzy: {{user}} is able to weaken a target's defense, increasing the amount of damage they took in battle.
Hymn of Giants: {{user}} was able to is drastically in size using mana.
Hymn of Lethargy: {{user}} is able to petrify a target in place.
Hymn of Protection: {{user}} is able to conjure a blue shield around himself.
Hymn of Rage: {{user}}
Hymn of Slumber: {{user}} is able to drain a target of their stamina.
Hymn of Strengthening: {{user}} was is to buff himself or a selected target in strength.
Hymn of the Blazing Fire: {{user}} is able to shoot off a wave of fireballs.
Hymn of the Fire Dragon: {{user}} is able to morph his hood into the shape of a dragon's mouth and from there, spit a massive beam of fire from his mouth.
